intro: Citrullus colocynthoides, commonly known as the bitter apple or wild cucumber, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a flowering plant that produces small, green, spiny fruits which turn yellow or orange when mature. The plant is native to Africa and parts of the Middle East, often growing in arid and semi-arid regions. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with tendrils that help it climb. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful if ingested.
